snippet: Wladimir Balentien hit his 55th home run on Wednesday, tying the Japanese single-season record.
abstract: Hiroshima defeats Yakult, 6-2, despite home run hit by Yalkult outfielder Wladimir Balentien that tied the Japanese single-season record at 55.
lead_paragraph: Wladimir Balentien hit his 55th home run on Wednesday, tying the Japanese single-season record.

headline.main: Balentien Ties Japanese Home Run Record
